The old woman smiled, her eyes sparkling. “You speak the truth, child. The bonds we create with others are what make us truly rich.”

As the waters rippled, Miora felt a weight lifted from her shoulders. “You have proven your wisdom. The second trial is complete.”

With the trials behind her, Miora stood before a magnificent tree, its bark glistening with luminescent markings. “You have proven your worth, dear child,” the spirits said. “This tree is the heart of the forest. And Miora, the girl who had answered the call of the ancestors, stood as a bridge between the past and the future, forever entwined with the magic of the forest she cherished.
